description: Returns license recommendations for Amazon EC2 instances that run on a specific license. Compute Optimizer generates recommendations for licenses that meet a specific set of requirements. For more information, see the Supported resources and requirements in the Compute Optimizer User Guide.

parameters.name: resourceArns
parameters.description: The ARN that identifies the Amazon EC2 instance. The following is the format of the ARN: arn:aws:ec2:region:aws_account_id:instance/instance-id (string) ---

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of license recommendations to return with a single request. To retrieve the remaining results, make another request with the returned nextToken value.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: An array of objects to specify a filter that returns a more specific list of license recommendations. (dict) --- Describes a filter that returns a more specific list of license recommendations. Use this filter with the GetLicenseRecommendation action. name (string) --- The name of the filter. Specify Finding to return recommendations with a specific finding classification. Specify FindingReasonCode to return recommendations with a specific finding reason code. You can filter your license recommendations by tag:key and tag-key tags. A tag:key is a key and value combination of a tag assigned to your license recommendations. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all license recommendations that have a tag with the key of Owner and the value of TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. A tag-key is the key of a tag assigned to your license recommendations. Use this filter to find all of your license recommendations that have a tag with a specific key. This doesn't consider the tag value. For example, you can find your license recommendations with a tag key value of Owner or without any tag keys assigned. values (list) --- The value of the filter. The valid values for this parameter are as follows, depending on what you specify for the name parameter: If you specify the name parameter as Finding, then specify Optimized, NotOptimized, or InsufficentMetrics. If you specify the name parameter as FindingReasonCode, then specify Optimized, LicenseOverprovisioned, InvalidCloudwatchApplicationInsights, or CloudwatchApplicationInsightsError. (string) ---

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the filter. Specify Finding to return recommendations with a specific finding classification. Specify FindingReasonCode to return recommendations with a specific finding reason code. You can filter your license recommendations by tag:key and tag-key tags. A tag:key is a key and value combination of a tag assigned to your license recommendations. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all license recommendations that have a tag with the key of Owner and the value of TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. A tag-key is the key of a tag assigned to your license recommendations. Use this filter to find all of your license recommendations that have a tag with a specific key. This doesn't consider the tag value. For example, you can find your license recommendations with a tag key value of Owner or without any tag keys assigned.

nested_params.name: values
nested_params.description: The value of the filter. The valid values for this parameter are as follows, depending on what you specify for the name parameter:

parameters.name: accountIds
parameters.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account for which to return license recommendations. If your account is the management account of an organization, use this parameter to specify the member account for which you want to return license recommendations. Only one account ID can be specified per request. (string) ---

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use to advance to the next page of license recommendations.

nested_items.name: licenseRecommendations
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe license recommendations.

nested_items.name: resourceArn
nested_items.description: The ARN that identifies the Amazon EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: accountId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the license.

nested_items.name: currentLicenseConfiguration
nested_items.description: An object that describes the current configuration of an instance that runs on a license.

nested_items.name: numberOfCores
nested_items.description: The current number of cores associated with the instance.

nested_items.name: instanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type used in the license.

nested_items.name: operatingSystem
nested_items.description: The operating system of the instance.

nested_items.name: licenseEdition
nested_items.description: The edition of the license for the application that runs on the instance.

nested_items.name: licenseName
nested_items.description: The name of the license for the application that runs on the instance.

nested_items.name: licenseModel
nested_items.description: The license type associated with the instance.

nested_items.name: licenseVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the license for the application that runs on the instance.

nested_items.name: metricsSource
nested_items.description: The list of metric sources required to generate recommendations for commercial software licenses.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The name of the metric source provider.

nested_items.name: providerArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the metric source provider.

nested_items.name: lookbackPeriodInDays
nested_items.description: The number of days for which utilization metrics were analyzed for an instance that runs on a license.

nested_items.name: lastRefreshTimestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the license recommendation was last generated.

nested_items.name: finding
nested_items.description: The finding classification for an instance that runs on a license.
InsufficentMetrics -- When Compute Optimizer detects that your CloudWatch Application Insights isn't enabled or is enabled with insufficient permissions.
NotOptimized -- When Compute Optimizer detects that your EC2 infrastructure isn't using any of the SQL server license features you're paying for, a license is considered not optimized.
Optimized -- When Compute Optimizer detects that all specifications of your license meet the performance requirements of your workload.

nested_items.name: findingReasonCodes
nested_items.description: The reason for the finding classification for an instance that runs on a license.
Optimized -- All specifications of your license meet the performance requirements of your workload.
LicenseOverprovisioned -- A license is considered over-provisioned when your license can be downgraded while still meeting the performance requirements of your workload.
InvalidCloudwatchApplicationInsights -- CloudWatch Application Insights isn't configured properly.
CloudwatchApplicationInsightsError -- There is a CloudWatch Application Insights error.

nested_items.name: licenseRecommendationOptions
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe the license recommendation options.

nested_items.name: rank
nested_items.description: The rank of the license recommendation option.

nested_items.name: operatingSystem
nested_items.description: The operating system of a license recommendation option.

nested_items.name: licenseEdition
nested_items.description: The recommended edition of the license for the application that runs on the instance.

nested_items.name: licenseModel
nested_items.description: The recommended license type associated with the instance.

nested_items.name: savingsOpportunity
nested_items.description: Describes the savings opportunity for recommendations of a given resource type or for the recommendation option of an individual resource.

nested_items.name: savingsOpportunityPercentage
nested_items.description: The estimated monthly savings possible as a percentage of monthly cost by adopting Compute Optimizer recommendations for a given resource.

nested_items.name: estimatedMonthlySavings
nested_items.description: An object that describes the estimated monthly savings amount possible by adopting Compute Optimizer recommendations for a given resource. This is based on the On-Demand instance pricing..

nested_items.name: currency
nested_items.description: The currency of the estimated monthly savings.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the estimated monthly savings.

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: A list of tags assigned to an EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: One part of a key-value pair that makes up a tag. A key is a general label that acts like a category for more specific tag values.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: One part of a key-value pair that make up a tag. A value acts as a descriptor within a tag category (key). The value can be empty or null.

nested_items.name: errors
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe errors of the request.

nested_items.name: identifier
nested_items.description: The ID of the error.

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The message, or reason, for the error.
